title: Why rugby will always struggle to go truly global: Only Japan have truly captured the imagination - the big teams must expose themselves more
text:
Japan have carried this World Cup in the sense of selling rugby beyond its heartlands. It falls to the more established nations this weekend to do their bit and stop hiding behind PR blandness.

Rugby union’s mantra of “growing the game” has not been well served by the media strategies of some big countries here. And yes, England are among those nations who, while meeting World Rugby press requirements, have tried to dampen interest in their players by repeating party lines in interviews.
